Julie está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This "Semillero" communal bank is composed of 16 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different trades, among which are selling firewood, selling new clothes, selling food, sportswear, selling mayonnaise, and making dough, among other services. All come from Padre Las Casas, near the city of Temuco.

Julie, president of the communal bank, is sitting in the front row of the photo in third place from left to right, wearing a purple jacket and with her long dark brown hair worn loose. She has her daughter in her arms. Julie dedicates her time to decorating and engraving glass, which she has done for 9 months. She says she works from home Monday to Friday, arranging her work schedule according to her availability. She buys the items for engraving from wholesale distributors, and decorates, polishes and draws figures on them. She buys at low cost so it makes good economic sense. With the loan she intends to buy glasses and wooden boxes for engraving. Her short term goals are to get people aware of her workshop and her glass engraving. In the medium and long term her goals are to expand her workshop, to generate more income, and with this to obtain a better quality of life. Julie lives with her 2 children: her 18 year old son who is studying and her little girl who is 11 months old. Her dream is to increase her skills in her field and get her work known in the local area and beyond, while creating jobs for others in need. Julie is very happy and grateful for the loan and the service provided by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very comfortable in meetings of the communal bank, as there is an atmosphere of generosity and unity. 

Padre Las Casas is a community in southern Chile, near the city of Temuco, Araucania region. The town was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of the indigenous people during the conquest of America. The town boasts a large indigenous (Mapuche) population. Its economy is based on agribusiness and commercial services.

loans.use: To buy glasses and wooden boxes to engrave

loans.name: Catherini

texts.en:
Catherini is 39 years old.  She is the single mother of two children aged 12 and eight years who both attend school.  She has a retail business in Nakuru town where she sells household items like jugs, basins, kitchen utensils and children’s clothing.

This will be Catherini's first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy mattresses to sell in her business.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business by adding more items to sell.

In the future, Catherini hopes to grow her business and increase her income so that she can provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Lima Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Grety tiene 34 años, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  a su negocio, la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que más le solicitan como familiares y amistades, la socia es una persona responsable y con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de casacas para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican a la carpinteria, compra y venta de ropa, tienda de abarrotes, venta de muebles, venta de tarjetas telefónicas.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Part of the Santa Rosita de Lima communal bank in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco, Grety is 34 and is married with one son. Alongside her daily chores she runs a business buying and selling clothes. She has spent years in this business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in. She travels to Lima to buy her goods and then sells them to her customers, many of whom are family and friends. Grety is aresponsible member of the communal bank and eager to continue working for her family. She is requesting the loan to buy coats for her business.

The other members of the group are engaged in carpentry, buying and selling clothing, running a grocery store, selling furniture, and selling phone cards. 

Grety is grateful to have this access to credit and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: To buy coats for her business

loans.name: Kodi

texts.en:
Kodi is married and has 2 children, both of whom attend school. She dreams of seeing them achieve success and every day she works to support her family through her business.   

Kodi has a restaurant located in the community of Likoni where she sells stews, cream of cheese soup, maize meals and other dishes from her own delicious recipes traditional to the Coastal people. At first, she sold fried foods and natural fruit drinks, including orange, lemon, mango, watermelon and melon. Her business gradually expanded and she added common foods with the goal of catering to the clientele she had already won. Today she has a space in her house that has become too small to support the growth of her business; this is the challenge she faces. She needs to remodel this space and, in the future, move her business to a new location. Her Kiva loan is her first with Kiva Field Partner, Yehu Microfinance Trust.  With this loan, she will purchase ingredients such as rice, meats and vegetables in large volumes to earn discounts on cash purchases. She will also purchase tools for the kitchen in order to serve her clients more freely.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Shahasi

texts.en:
Shahasi lives in the town of Likoni, very close to the city of Mombasa, Kenya. In her community, she offers personal appearance improvement services that she provides on a door-to-door basis.  She also advises her customers on this subject and sells them beauty products according to the recommended treatment. Her main products are cosmetics, shampoos, hair treatments and nail polish. Her goal is to expand her business and to become the top distributor of cosmetics and beauty products so she can ensure a successful education for her children in the future.

She currently requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust, which she will use to purchase beauty products, cosmetics and supplies for providing her beauty services. Her investment will be successful because it will be based on orders from her profitable customers. Also, with money on hand, she will be able to purchase merchandise at a discount and in bulk which will result in higher than usual profits as well as very competitive prices which will benefit her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: La Vecindad Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Vecindad” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de cortinas y sabanas, venta de ropa interior, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Daniela, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color negro con una franja de color gris, usa aros de color plata y su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almohadas y cojines, desde hace 1 mes. Comenta que trabaja con su esposo, ella fabrica los cojines y almohadas y su esposo se encarga de salir a venderlos dentro y fuera de la ciudad.
La mercadería que necesita para realizar sus cojines y almohadas la compra en distribuidoras y locales de la cuidad de Santiago, donde encuentra todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará esponja, espuma, hilos y telas para confeccionar almohadas y cojines.
Sus metas son tener un taller propio, con maquinaria propia, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Daniela vive junto a su esposo quien le brinda apoyo en su negocio y su hija de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son instalar un taller establecido en su propia casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank called "La Vecindad" ("The Neighborhood") is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to commerce. Among them they have businesses selling clothes, curtains and sheets, underwear, storage, services and more. All are from the municipality of San Bernardo, located in the city of Santiago. 

Daniela, treasurer of the group, is sitting in the second row of the photo, second from the right, wearing a black shirt with a gray stripe, silver rings and her dark brown hair worn loose. She has been selling pillows and cushions for 1 month. She says that, working with her husband, she makes the cushions and pillows and her husband is responsible for selling them in and around the city. She buys the materials she needs for her cushions and pillows from local distributors and in the city of Santiago, where the low cost of materials means the work makes good economic sense. With the loan she intends to buy sponge, foam, thread and fabric to make pillows and cushions. Her goals are to have her own workshop, with her own sewing machine to generate more income, and thus to have a better quality of life. Daniela lives with her husband, who supports her in her business, and their daughter, who is 3 years old. Her dream for her business is to install a workshop at home. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity from Fondo Esperanza, which allows her to invest in her business. She also says she feels very comfortable in the company of other entrepreneurs in the group, because they do different interesting activities, which are fun. From the training given at meetings, Daniela has learned to manage her business better. 

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km south of the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is known as the capital of folklore, because each year, in January, the "International Folklore Festival" is held there, and the roots of the country come together and meet musicians from across South America. It also holds the "Traditional Crafts Fair," attended by both artisans from Chile and other nearby countries. In April the "April cuecas Mil" event takes place in the city, with the whole community dancing the cueca (a traditional Chilean dance).


Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Vecindad” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de cortinas y sabanas, venta de ropa interior, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Daniela, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color negro con una franja de color gris, usa aros de color plata y su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almohadas y cojines, desde hace 1 mes. Comenta que trabaja con su esposo, ella fabrica los cojines y almohadas y su esposo se encarga de salir a venderlos dentro y fuera de la ciudad.

Con el crédito comprará esponja, espuma, hilos y telas para confeccionar almohadas y cojines.
Sus metas son tener un taller propio, con maquinaria propia, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Daniela vive junto a su esposo quien le brinda apoyo en su negocio y su hija de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son instalar un taller establecido en su propia casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.

Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.

loans.use: To buy sponge, foam, thread and fabric to make pillows and cushions.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her clothing retail business.  She started working as a merchant two years ago.   She sells various merchandise including women's dresses, sleepwear, perfumes and cosmetics, and she delivers completed orders to her customers.  She sells on credit and recoups her investment weekly, biweekly, or monthly depending on the agreement with her customer. 

Fatuma wants to continually improve her business but her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her merchandise turnover increases. She is seeking a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Yehu Microfinance. With her loan, she will buy merchandise such as elegant dresses and shoes to fill her customers' orders and make sure they are well dressed.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as elegant dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Ahtam

texts.ru: Ахтам житель города Душанбе. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Ахтам имеет среднее образование. Он занимается торговлей. В этой области он четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Ahtam lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 20 years old, single, and has a secondary school diploma. Ahtam has been engaged in sales for four years. He is taking this loan to purchase children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy children's summer clothes

loans.name: Nudha

texts.en:
Nudha and her husband have two children, all of whom attend school. They live in Likoni city of Mombasa. 

Nudha operates a business making and selling fried foods at an open air market. She started the business because she needed a way to support her family. She starts her days early, working Mondays to Sundays, and she tells us that weekends and holidays are especially busy because there are more people around those days. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and then open a restaurant. Her sales are increasing by the day but she doesn't have enough working capital to expand further. 

Nudha is applying to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of maize, cooking oil and everything else that she needs to operate her business. The investment will allow her to buy what she needs for less than she would otherwise have to pay and avoid ever-rising prices. The savings will go to her rather than her suppliers. That's the power of Kiva loans and why this loan will be successful.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza lives south of Mombasa city and has a family business preparing food such as fried food and fast food. She has been gradually making progress attracting customers, mainly her neighbours and passers by. 

Now she is applying for her first loan, because she needs to grow and to do that she needs to find suppliers from whom she can buy in volume and on a cash basis, as they offer a better price. This is the reason for this Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use this loan to buy raw materials, such as cooking oil, cereals and tubers. Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts that will increase her profits right away, and also benefit her customers. 

Her goal for the future is to have her own place where she could operate a big restaurant, offering a variety of dishes that are specialties of the region. While she works to achieve her dreams, she will manage a 15 day rotation of accounts receivable, and her inventory turnover will be every 2 days; these are the financial indicators from which she projects her growth.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cooking oil, cereals and tubers.

loans.name: Oimgul

texts.ru: Оимгул проживает в городе. Душанбе. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Оимгул занимается торговлей женской домашней одежды и нижнего белья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Oimgul lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Oimgul sells women's casual clothing and underwear. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. She is taking this loan to increase her merchandise turnover.

loans.use: to purchase women's underwear and swimwear

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали житель города Истаравшан. Ему 47 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Нурали зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этом ему помогает его жена и дети. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 47 years old, married, and has six children. Nurali earns a living by breeding cattle. He is aided in this occupation by his wife and children. Nurali is taking this loan to purchase several calves in order to expand the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy several calves

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFAME est composé de treize personnes qui  habitent le même village. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier  de ALIDé afin d’élever le niveau de leur Le activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Adèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adèle est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Timothé. Le couple a sept enfants à charge, dont certains scolarisés et dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Adèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Adèle mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente de la farine de manioc dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adèle vend des fromages au soja. Ces activités lui permettent de contribuer aux besoins de sa famille. Adèle s’approvisionne dans son village. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FIFAME, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
FIFAME group is composed of thirteen people who live in the same village. This is the third time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business. The representative of the group, by the name of Adèle is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Adèle is 38 years old and is married to a certain Timothé. The couple has seven dependent children, of whom some go to school and six are their own children. Adèle lives together with her husband and her children. The diverse household responsibilities are taken care of by the couple.

To manage, for five years Adèle has been selling flour and manioc in her region. Simultaneously, Adèle sells soya cheese. These businesses allow her to contribute to the needs of her family. Adèle gets her supplies in her village. With the aim of satisfying her clientèle and to grow her turnover and her income, Adèle is requesting a third loan together with the other members of the FIFAME group.

loans.use: to buy a bag of soya and canteens of manioc.

loans.name: Irma Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Irma tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos en una colonia que pertenece al sector López Arellano.
Doña Irma siempre se ha dedicado al comercio porque le gusta mucho y ha sido su fuente de ingresos, ella vende todo tipo de mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos y productos de porcelana. El negocio lo tiene establecido en un local comercial donde hay afluencia de personas y sus ventas sus buenas. Para mantenerlo surtido ha invertido varios préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF. Actualmente solicita el sexto préstamo que es por Lps.8,500.00, el cual lo va invertir en surtir el negocio de mercadería, esperando aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y de las ganancias apoyar a sus hijos hasta que se gradúen en la universidad.
texts.en:
Doña Irma is 50 years old and has three children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in a neighborhood located in the sector of López Arellano.

Doña Irma has always worked in the retail trade because she enjoys it and it has become her source of income. She sells all types of merchandise such as clothing (for women, men, and children), shoes, and porcelain goods. Her business is located in a shopping center where there are crowds of people, which contributes to good sales. Irma has requested and invested several loans from ODEF in order to maintain her inventory.

She is currently requesting her sixth loan in the amount of 8,500 HNL. The money will be invested in merchandise to restock her business in hopes of increasing her sales and her profits. Her dream is to grow her business and her earnings so that she can support her children until they graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and porcelain goods.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 22 years old, comes from Nyahururu, and is married with one daughter who is four years old and in baby school.

Margaret practices mixed farming and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy pesticides and build a door and shelter for her animals.

She hopes to improve the living standards of her family and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and build a door and shelter for her animals

loans.name: Dafra Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of Dafra group located in Kiruhura, a predominantly pastoral area in Uganda. The group is comprised  mainly of cattle keepers who sell milk and cows.

Joyce, like the other members of the group, is a cattle keeper in addition to fattening them for sale. Through this, the 37-year-old married woman has been able to send her two children to good schools and also meet other family needs. Her dream is to own a very large herd of cows so that she can fully stabilise and supply milk to the city to maximise her profits. She is challenged mainly by cattle diseases and the hot weather.

Joyce is very hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu lives in Likoni, a tourist city in the coastal region called Mombasa. She has one child who attends school. 

Zainabu has a small store at home where she sells household goods like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She began the business three years ago with just a display case and few items. It gradually grew until it attained a more dynamic clientele.

At the present time, she plans to stock her business with seasonal products to increase her stock. However, her working capital is insufficient to reach this strategic goal, which is why Zainabu is calling on her Kiva loan, her first financing from Yehu Microfinance Trust, to buy merchandise to stock her variety store with wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

Her investment will be successful because potential demand will lead to increased sales and with them higher income to continue strengthening the variety store’s capital and this makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her variety store with wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be a creative man. He operates a retail business where he sells clothing materials. His business is located at a busy business area and his primary customers are local residents.

Fredrick describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of clothing materials. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothing materials. His business goal is to venture into a new business, a wholesale shop, within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and create job opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widow and lives in Likoni where she has her business selling dough from flour or rice with vegetables and chicken or pork. There she also sells the famous sweet cake baked from cassava, cheese, coconut, and sugar. As soon as she thought of her business idea, she began working towards it to achieve greater independence while earning income to support her own well-being and that of her family. 

Her biggest challenge is that with her growing clientele, her working capital is not sufficient to respond to the demand for products. This is the reason why for her fifth loan through Yehu Microfinance, she has come to Kiva. She will use the loan to buy supplies of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat in larger quantities in order to get discounts and she will also invest in merchandise like clothing and items for the home which her customers have ordered on credit with payment plans they have jointly decided on. Her goal is to continue to grow her business and plan a successful future for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 60 years old and a business man. He is married to Emily who is a business lady. They are blessed with seven children. For the past 20 years, he has done farming activity as a primary business and selling shoes as a secondary business with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. George will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, seedlings and stock the shoe business. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will buy the animal feed. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, seedlings and stock the shoe business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children and two of them are attending school. She is taking care of some grandchildren. She has been selling vegetables, raw food, dried fish, sugar, flour, cooking oil  and others from home for one year, retail, working seven days a week. She is also a property broker to earn more income.

She has applied for a loan of UShs1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase boxes of tomatoes, sacks of  Irish potatoes, green bananas, cooking oil, sugar, flour, fish and other items. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She joined MCDT to get more capital for her business.  She would like to expand her business and start wholesale. She lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: purchase buy boxes of tomatoes, sacks of  Irish potatoes, green bananas, cooking oil, sugar, flour, fish and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children, five of whom are going to school. She is looking after her mother.
She has been selling charcoal for the last two years from home and sells retail, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT to enable her to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her major challenges include seasonality. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. Her dream is to become a wholesaler.  She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Eliko

texts.en:
Eliko is 65 years old. She lives in a small village of Khashuri District with her family: her husband – Shalva, her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (13 and 16 years old). Both of the children study in the local school. The family earns its living through agricultural business. They have two milking cows, from whose milk they produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. Also, they have 2 calves and 5 sheep. The family owns 2 hectares of land as well, where they grow maize and haricots. The family is especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell on the local open market. Their total average monthly income is 1000 Lari. 

Eliko requested a loan for her agricultural business. The family plans to repair the cattle-shed, because the existing one is old. After they repair it, they will be able to keep more livestock there. Also, they will make hay from the mowed grass from their agricultural land to feed the cattle instead of buying it at a high price. Due to the above mentioned, the family will be able to get more milk and increase cheese production. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve their living conditions. Eliko hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair the cattle-shed

loans.name: Yeison Abel

texts.es:
Yeison es un hombre de 20 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, a pesar de su corta edad es un joven muy entusiasta y trabajador, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yeison trabaja como obrero embotellador de una bodega vitivinícola de su ciudad, el labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se encuentra muy a gusto con la labor que realiza ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Yeison se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder terminar de construir la casa de sus padres con quienes vive; asimismo, espera poder comprar algunos artefactos para acondicionar su casa, tales como: una cocina y un horno microondas; de esta marera Yeison podrá brindar mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeison is a 20 year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. Despite his young age, he is a very enthusiastic and hardworking young man with a great wish to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to lack of resources and because he had to work to pay his expenses, he was not able to attend college but he would have liked to have studied Agricultural Engineering. In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors. Occasionally he cooks a very delicious “carapulcra con sopa seca” [a Peruvian dish made with dried potatoes, meat and sauce] to share with his family.

With a great deal of determination and dedication, Yeison works as a bottler in a winery in his city. He works approximately 12 hours daily and is very pleased with the work because he is highly regarded for his good performance and friendly demeanor towards others.

Yeison is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to make improvements to his dwelling. He wants to finish building his parent’s house, where he lives. He hopes to be able to purchase some appliances to equip the home, such as a stove and a microwave oven. Thus he will be able to provide his family greater security and comfort.

loans.use: To improve his parent's house and buy appliances.

loans.name: Kuña Pyryry Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 11 integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación, son clientes hace muchos años con excelente conducta. El comité ya tiene mucha de experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  años los que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo.
Una de las integrantes, Pablina, está acompañada con Carlos es comerciante tienen 1 hijo. Pablina se dedica a la venta de ropa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar ,  se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando en la casa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno de todo tipo, ya que se acerca el tiempo de frio y tendrá mucha demanda de esas prendas. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 11 members from the city of Encarnacion.  They have been clients of the Fundacion Paraguaya for many years, and they have had excellent conduct.  This group already has a lot of experience with group work because of the years that they have been working together. They meet every week to share, communicate and keep informed about all of the innovations that are generated within the group.  

One of the members, Pablina, has a partner named Carlos and a son.  She is a merchant who sells clothing.  With the income she earns, she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She joined the group from her neighborhood, because with the help that the Fundacion Paraguaya provides, she can continue to grow her business and in this way, continue to help her household.

She is requesting a loan to buy all types of winter clothing, because the cold weather season is approaching and she will have a lot of demand for these garments.  

Pablina is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es el grupo formados por mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, este grupo lleva ese nombre por su santa patrona que es la virgen del Rosario. Las miembros son mujeres jefas de familia que dia a dia se esfuerzan por salir adelnate.
La sra.Angelica se dedica a la venta de bebidas y mini carga, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella sueña con crecer y trabajar y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia, ya que ella es su sosten. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is a group comprising women from the city of Luque. This group owes its name to its patron saint, which is Our Lady of the Rosary. Its members are head of household women who work hard day after day to get ahead.
Angelica works selling drinks and prepaid phone cards. She is single and doesn't have any children. Her dream is to keep growing and working so that she can help her family, since she is their means of support. That is why she is requesting the loan, to purchase beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wine, and other kinds. This will allow her to continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks for sale.

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is 46 years old. She is a widow and lives with her 24-year-old son – Otar. The main source of the income of the family is farming. They grow tomatoes, potatoes, maize and onions on family-owned land. Also, Taliko has chickens and a milk cow and produces cheese. She sells harvested produce in nearby villages. In addition, to their agricultural business Taliko works in the local school. She is an accountant and gets a salary. Otar works in the police and gets a salary as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Taliko requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and seedlings of tomatoes. She will cultivate the land and sow more tomatoes and other vegetables there. She will work hard during spring and summer seasons and after the seasonal work is properly done, she hopes to get a good harvest. As a result of the above-mentioned activities, Taliko will get additional income. With increased income she will be able to repair the house. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to cutivate land and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio's business has been in operation for over 10 years now. When he moved to the United States from Argentina, he knew that to be successful he should build on his extensive knowledge of construction and electrics. He and his wife, Clide, built the company from the ground up and it has provided him and his family a living for many years. His wife Clide also has a full-time job as a tailor. She provides her services to individuals, hotels, television stations, and production companies. 

Julio primarily works with contractors who speak very highly of him - many attest to his excellent work, his diligence and professionalism. Both Julio and Clide feel that in coming to the U.S., they regained their dignity and have had the opportunity to build a business, work, feel useful, and contribute to society. They are known by all as very hard-working, honest and humble people. 

With his loan, Julio will purchase much needed electric equipment for a large upcoming project. Julio hopes the business continues to grow so that he can expand the services his company offers.

loans.use: to purchase electric equipment for an upcoming project

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel tiene 44 años, está casado con la Sra. Delia de 36 años, ellos tienen ocho hijos de los cuales 5 están cursando sus estudios secundarios y 3 sus estudios primarios. 
Don Miguel empezó como comerciante, hace más de siete años,  desde el año 2005. Él comenzó con un dinero que juntó trabajando como empleado de una carpintería, durante varios años, luego de casarse la señora le ayudo a abrir una despensa, que al correr de los años fue creciendo, y en la actualidad ellos mantienen una gran clientela en la comunidad, por los buenos tratos y la variedad de productos que ofrecen en su negocio. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, harinas, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc. Con lo cual desea poder surtir su negocio y darle mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel, 44, is married to Delia, 36; they have 8 children five of which are attending secondary school and three elementary school.

Miguel started out as a merchant over seven years ago since 2005.  He started out with some money he’d saved up working as an employee in a carpentry shop for several years.  After getting married, his wife helped him open a store which has grown over the years.  They currently have a large clientele in the community because of their good service and the variety of products they offer in their store.

He’s asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks, flour, oil, sugar, noodles, etc. to stock the store and provide wider variety for his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" lléva 4 años de formación y trabájo con al Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya viene realizando una actividad productiva con la cual ayudan a sus familias.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes de éste comité , se unió al comité por la necesidad de tener una forma de ayudar y sostener a su familia, es vendedora ambulante de remedios naturales y tambien realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser alumino , plasticos , papel , hierro , etc. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para seguir vendiendo y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” (Women Working Together) committee has been in operation for four years working with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the members have been carrying out productive activities with which they help their families.

Marta is one of this committee’s members.  She joined the committee because she needed to have a way of helping and supporting her family.  She’s a street vendor of natural remedies and also recyclable materials like aluminum, plastic, paper, metal, etc.  She hopes for a better future for her children which is why she strives daily to give them the opportunity to study and attain a better future.

She’s asking for the loan to buy natural remedies to continue selling thus continuing to help her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Titomagba Group

texts.fr: Le groupement TITOMAGBA est composé de seize personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Gbèhouédé Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gbèhouédé Pierrette est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Robert. Gbèhouédé Pierrette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Gbèhouédé Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Gbèhouédé Pierrette mène comme activité, la vente de bananes et de l'huile de palme qu'elle produit dans sa région. Gbèhouédé Pierrette s’approvisionne aussi dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Gbèhouédé Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement TITOMAGBA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Titomagba group has 16 members who all live in the same area. This is the first time that this group has asked for financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels. 

The group’s representative is called Gbèhouédé Pierrette, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 28 years of age and is married to a man named Robert. She has three children, some of whom are at school. They are all under the care of the couple. 

Gbèhouédé Pierrette lives together with her husband and children, and the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are met. To do so, Gbèhouédé Pierrette works selling bananas and palm oil, which she produces in her region. She also gets her supplies within her region. 

In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Gbèhouédé Pierrette has requested her first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Titomagba group.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas and palm nuts.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: La señora Demetria tiene 49 es casada, su esposo se fue al extranjero hace más de 11 años, ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son casados e independientes todos sus hijos viven  en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, La Sra. Demetria tiene casa propia en la zona de Huayllani. La Sra. Demetria vende verduras los fines de semana, es decir viaja los días viernes y vende los días sábados y domingos, compra por cargas y los lleva a la localidad de Yapacani donde los distribuye y comercializa, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras por carga como papa ya que esta época sube de precio,  ella  trabaja mucho ya que esta actividad le permite mantenerse, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Demetria is 49 years old and married.  Her husband went abroad more than 11 years ago. She has four children, all of whom are independent and married. All live in the city of Santa Cruz. 

Sra. Demetria has her own home in the Huayllani area. She sells vegetables on weekends. That is, she travels on Fridays and sells on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys in bulk and carries the produce to the town of Yapacani where she distributes and sells it.  

With money from the loan she will buy vegetables by the load, such as potatoes because the price goes up this season. She works hard because this business enables her to support herself. She is grateful for the opportunity being provided her.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in volume.

loans.name: Ayidohotcheme Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOHOTCHEME est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Virginie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Virginie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Virginie est âgée de 22 ans et est mariée à un certain Robert. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants du couple sont scolarisés. Virginie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Virginie vend depuis cinq ans, des produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc) et de l’huile de palme dans un marché de sa région. Virginie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Virginie et les autres membres du groupement AYIDOHOTCHEME sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Ayidohotcheme group has 15 members, who all live in the same town. The group’s representative is called Virginie, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. To increase their level of business and better meet their customers’ needs, the group has asked for financial support from Alidé for the first time.

Virginie did not go to school. She is 22 years of age and married to a man named Robert. The couple has five children under their care, two of whom are their own children. All of the couple’s children go to school. Virginie and her husband live together with their children, and they both make sure that the family’s various expenses are met. 

To contribute to meeting these expenses, Virginie has worked for the past five years selling foodstuffs (corn, cassava flour) and palm oil in a market in her region. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

In order to strengthen their business and better meet their customers’ needs, Virginie and the other members of the Ayidohotcheme group have asked for their first loan from Alidé. Their ambition is to increase their business.

loans.use: To buy bags of cassava flour and corn.

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.fr: Monsieur Yakhya vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et évolue dans le secteur du commerce avec comme spécialité la vente d’aliment de bétail notamment le blé, le mil, le maïs, le sorgho…etc. En effet, il exerce ce métier depuis plus de deux ans et fait aussi du carrelage parallèlement. Ce premier crédit sollicité de montant 150.000 francs CFA lui permettra d’accroitre son stock de produit  pour mieux faire face à l’accroissement éventuel de la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Yakhya lives in Senegal. He is single, and works in the trade sector, selling livestock feed (wheat, millet, corn, sorghum, etc.).  He has worked in this job for over two years, and also works laying tiles.

This is his first loan, and is for 150,000 francs CFA. It will allow Yakhya to increase his stock of products so that he can be better prepared for future growth in customer demand.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for resale.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru:
Динаре 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей - школьников. Динара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 27 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Динары имеется 4 дойной коровы, 10 овцематок, выручка с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 18,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы с целью увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Dinara is a forty-five year old married mother of three children. Her main source of income comes from a cattle raising business she began twenty-seven years ago. She started the business with a capital of 5,000 soms (KGS); today, her business has grown to contain 4 milking cows, 10 sheep, and an 18,000 soms per month income generated from the sale of milk and milk products. 

Hoping to expand her business even further, Dinara approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 55,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase a milking cow and increase milk production. 
She plans to reinvest the profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Hafiswa

texts.en:
Hafiswa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with one child who attends school. She is not looking after additional family members.
She has been selling cosmetics for the last four years in a shop she rents. She sells at retail, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT to enable her purchase more cosmetics for sale like boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. Her major challenges include the high transport costs and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She joined MCDT because she was assured that she would benefit from the services offered. Her dream is to see her business expand. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cosmetics like cream relaxers, braids, and weaves

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel nació en el año 1985 y actualmente reside en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la Provincia de Cotopaxi . Latacunga está ubicada en el centro del Ecuador en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi, que ya ha destruido a la ciudad tres veces desde su fundación. En la ciudad se puede apreciar la arquitectura de la época colonial y sus habitantes se caracterizan por celebrar varias fiestas que contienen creencias de varias culturas como la “Mama Negra” que es una celebración originada con tradiciones africanas, indígenas y españolas.  
José Manuel se dedica 4 horas al día y los fines de semana desde hace 6 años a su negocio de cerrajería y trabajos en metal como marcos de puertas y ventanas así como estructuras para proteger las mismas. Él solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar más materia prima y así poder  cumplir más rápido con sus contratos y de esta manera generar mejores  ingresos, y progresar en su negocio y como persona. José  De esta manera, estará preparado para cumplir sueños tales como formar una familia o tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
José Manuel was born in 1985 and currently lives in the city of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi. Latacunga is located in central Ecuador, at the foot of the highest active volcano in the world, the Cotopaxi, which has destroyed the city three times since it was founded. The city displays colonial arquitecture, and its residents are known for celebrating several festivities which comprise multicultural beliefs, such as the “Mama Negra,” which originated from African, indigenous, and Spanish traditions.
José Manuel has been working in his business for six years, four hours a day and weekends. He is a locksmith and also works with metal, building door and window frames, as well as structures to protect doors and windows. 
He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more raw materials so that he can finish contracts faster, generate a better income, and move forward with his business and also personally. This way, José will be prepared to make his dreams come true, such as starting a family and owning a home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesus Obrero” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comerciante, específicamente a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que tiene una persona que le ayuda en su puesto de trabajo que lo ubica en las  ferias libres, su horario de trabajo es de 9ºº hasta  las 20ºº horas.
Su mercadería la compra directamente en supermercados y distribuidoras de frutas y verduras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frutas y verduras, y agregará venta de legumbres.
Una de sus metas es seguir con el negocio, seguir creciendo, abastecerlo de otros productos como legumbres,  ya que su misma clientela le ha ido solicitando y además para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Mariela vive junto a su esposo quien le brinda apoyo en su negocio, y 2 hijos, uno de  20 años de edad, quien se encuentra trabajando y una hija de 12 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es terminar de arreglar su casa para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Mariela está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesus Obrero” which is located in the city of Curicó. She has been in the retail trade for nine years, specifically the sale of fruits and vegetables. Mariela says that she has one employee who helps with managing her stand, which is located at the open fairs. Her work schedule is from 9am to 8pm. The merchandise is purchased directly from supermarkets and produce distributors, since these vendors sell their goods at low cost, which is financially convenient for her.

With this loan, she will buy fruits and vegetables, as well as add legumes to her inventory. One of her goals is to continue her business and keep growing by restocking with other products, such as legumes. By providing what her customers request, she will be able to generate more income and achieve a better quality of life.

Mariela lives with her husband who helps with her business. They have two children, a 20-year-old who is working and a 12-year-old daughter who is studying. Her dreams for her family include finishing the renovations to her house so that her family will have a better quality of life. Mariela is very pleased with and appreciative of the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. In addition, she feels very comfortable at the meetings conducted by her Communal Bank, which promotes generosity and unity.

Curicó is located in the region of Maule, an area in the central part of the country. The climate in Curicó is similar to that of the Mediterranean and is considered to be one of the most pleasant in the country. Curicó is also known for its wine culture and the natural beauty of its surrounding areas. Even though the job market has gotten stronger, this area continues to be one of the poorest in the country according to the last census.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 35 years old. She is from Kareli District and lives with her family, husband Zviad and two children (13 and 16 years old). Both of the children go to the local school. The family runs agricultural activities. They have 1 hectare of land, where they grow cabbage, potatoes and apples. They sell harvested products in nearby villages from their own truck. Zviad also has BMW vehicle and provides taxi services to the local population. Zviad gets a service fee for the work. Maia is the agricultural worker; she helps local farmers in agricultural activities and gets 20 Lari for one day. They work hard, but still don’t have enough income to set aside some savings to improve living conditions of the family. Their total average monthly income is 800 Lari.

Maia requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and to pay for workers. She will hire workers, which will help her in farming. After cultivation and fertilization of the land, Maia will be able to sow more vegetables and fruits there. Thus, she will get more agricultural products. Maia and Zviad will sell more products from their own truck in nearby villages. This will increase the sales. With increased profits they will be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs. The above mentioned living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for workers.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 33 years old. She lives in a small village of Kashuri District with her family, husband Revaz, mother-in-law, who is a pensioner, and two children (13 and 15 years old). Both children study in the village school. Revaz is a worker in construction and gets a service fee for his work. Maia runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land where haricot, maize, onions, garlic and potatoes are grown. She sells her harvested products on the local open market. In addition to farming she has a milking cow, produces cheese, and sells it in the village. Maia and Revaz work hard; they still don’t have enough income to set aside some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or to finance the studies of their children. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari. 

Maia requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow and a calf. She will be able to produce more dairy food: cheese, curds, and yogurt. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to finance the studies of her children and purchase household items. As a result of the loan, the family will be able to improve their living conditions. Maia and Zviad hope for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with no children. She is taking care of her mother. 
She has been selling raw and cooked yams from the market for 5 years at retail and wholesale, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase more sacks of yams. Her major business challenges include seasonality, and high prices. She joined MCDT to better herself. She would like to expand her business and accumulate profits. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of yams.

loans.name: Edgar Paul

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre que reside en Latacunga, ciudad ubicada en el centro de la cierra Ecuatoriana. Latacunga es la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, nombrada después  del volcán activo más alta del mundo que está que esta al noreste de la misma. El Cotopaxi ha dejado a Latacunga en la ruina tres veces desde su fundación. La ciudad está a 2750 metros sobre el nivel del mar y la temperatura promedio es alrededor de 11°C. Latacunga se caracteriza por su riqueza arquitectónica y cultural, ya que ha logrado preservar un aspecto colonial y es un excelente ejemplo de folklor nacional. 
Edgar es un hombre soltero que desde hace dos años abrió un MiniMarket al frente de unas canchas deportivas. Él aprendió acerca del negocio por su madre, y ahora sueña con que su propio MiniMarket salga adelante. Edgar le pone 6 horas al día a su negocio. Él solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder incrementar el número de productos e implementar nueva mercadería a su negocio. Edgar ambiciona con poder superarse y tiene muchas expectativas para su MiniMarket y para el mismo. Por lo tanto quiere agrandar su negocio y lograr tener ingresos suficientes para continuar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Edgar is a man who lives in Latacunga, a city located in the midst of the Ecuadorian mountains. Latacunga is the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, named after the highest active volcano in the world, which is in the northeast of the province. The Cotopaxi volcano has left Latacunga in ruins three times since its founding. The city is 2,750 meters above sea level and the average temperature is about 11°C.  It is characterized by it architectural and cultural riches since it have been possible to preserve its colonial appearance. Latacanga is an excellent example of national folklore.

Edgar is a bachelor who opened a mini-market two years ago in front of some sports fields. He learned the business from his mother and now dreams about his own mini-market getting ahead. He devotes 6 hours a day to his business. He is requesting a loan from Kiva to be able to expand the quantity of products he sells and to start selling new merchandise altogether. 

Edgar is ambitious and wants to succeed and has high expectations for his minimarket and for himself. Consequently, he wants to enlarge his business and earn enough income to continue his studies at college.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tafsir Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Tafsir Mamadou habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et a un enfant en charge. Il est charretier. Ça fait plus de deux ans qui’ il fait du transport charretier après avoir quitté sa première fonction de pécheur.  Ce premier crédit sollicité d’un  montant  de 200.000 francs CFA lui offrira la possibilité  d’acheter un cheval supplémentaire dans le but  d’en faire une charrette de transport, ce qui lui permettra  de supporter d’avantage ses charges familiales. Son projet futur est de devenir un grand éleveur de moutons, il souhaite aussi  élargir le nombre de ses employés à travers l’achat d’autres chevaux.
texts.en:
Tafsir Mamadou lives in Senegal. He is single, and has one child under his care. He works in cart transportation, and has done so for more than two years since he left his first job as a fisherman. 

This is the first loan he has requested, and it is for 200,000 francs CFA. The money will allow him to buy an additional horse for a transport cart, which will enable him to better support his family expenses. In the future he would like to become a successful sheep farmer, and he also wants to increase his employees by buying other horses.

loans.use: To buy a horse for his business.

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia réside au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce comme vendeuse de savon. Elle exerce ce travail depuis  plus de 10 ans. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs CFA. Avec ce prêt, elle compte renforcer son fonds de roulement. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement  et d’accroitre principalement ses ressources d’approvisionnement pour  répondre a l’évolution de la demande des clients. Dans le futur, elle souhaite disposer d’un grand magasin de divers produits cosmétiques dans l’objectif de diversifier son activité et de la rendre plus rentable.
texts.en:
Khoudia lives in Senegal. She is married and has worked selling soap for more than ten years- She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA.

Khoudia plans to use the loan to increase her working capital. This will allow her to expand her capital and, mainly, to increase her resources and supplies to meet changes in her customers’ requests. In the future she would like to have a large store selling various cosmetic products, so that she can diversify her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy soap to resell.

loans.name: Dagbemabou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEMABOU est composé de douze personnes qui habitent la même zone. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupement, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à certain Bertin. Le couple a dix enfants dont certains scolarisés et cinq restent à leur charge. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Célestine mène comme activité depuis quinze ans la vente d'huile de palme et de maïs de façon secondaire dans sa région. Célestine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEMABOU, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The Dagbemabou group has 12 members who all live in the same area. This is the first time that they have requested the financial assistance of Alidé, and have done so to increase their business levels. 

The group’s representative is called Célestine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 52 years of age and is married to a man named Bertin. The couple has 10 children, some of whom go to school and all of whom are under their care. 

Célestine did not go to school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she has worked for 15 years selling palm oil and, on a secondary level, corn in her region. Célestine gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Célestine and the other members of the Dagbemabou group have asked for their first loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and palm oil.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of them go to school. She is not taking care of any other family members. She has been selling secondhand clothes from the market for ten years at retail, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for sale. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She joined MCDT because of timely loans. She aspires to expand her business for more profits. She stays in her husband's house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is cohabiting with no children. She is taking care of her mother, niece, and brother. 
She has been keeping poultry and pigs and has operated laundry services for two years at both wholesale and retail, working seven days a week. She also supplies chapats and roasted groundnuts to shops and school canteens for more income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her construct a poultry house. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high prices for feeds. She joined MCDT because of timely loans and low interest charged. She aspires to expand her business to 10,000 birds and at least 30 pigs. She stays in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to construct a poultry house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She has been selling sugar, soap, rice, cooking oil, and other basic commodities for the last three years from home and sells at retail, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT to enable her purchase commodities like cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava, and maize flour for sale. Her major challenges include the high transport costs. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale. She lives in her husband`s house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Safianah

texts.en: Safianah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children and two of them are attending school. She is taking care of some grandchildren. She has been keeping poultry at home for six years at retail, working seven days a week. She also sells tap water as an additional source of income. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase chicks and feeds. Her major business challenges include death of the birds before maturity and the high prices of feeds. She joined MCDT to get more capital for her business. She would like to expand her business and accumulate profits. She stays in her husband`s house without access to  electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are medical bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 15, and 17. Her husband is a fisherman.

Gloria has been involved in seaweed farming for 10 years. She works hard to help provide for her family and send her children to school. She has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs. Gloria hopes to increase her income and be able to pay for her children's school fees. She also hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small calf and vaccinations for his cattle.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba sells doughnuts and has done so for 6 years. She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. Habiba  will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a petty trader. She sells onions at Nkramofokrom near Cape Coast, and she has done so for 6 years. Yaa is married to a mason, and she and her husband have 4 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Yaa will use her loan to purchase bags of onions to sell. With the new profit, she wants to sell a wider variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: In the photo, Ama is pounding fufu. For the past two years, she has operated a chop bar, where a variety of African dishes are sold. The foods she serves  are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. Ama is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit,  Ama plans to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare  the food she sells

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cloth and scarves. She lives together with her husband and 4 children at Nkarmfofokrom near Cape Coast.  Ama has been selling cloth for 3 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase a wider variety of fabrics to sell in her store. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fabrics to sell in her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cloth and scarfs. She lives together with her husband and 4 children at Nkramfokrom, near Cape Coast.  Ekua has been selling cloth for 3 years now. she uses her income to help her husband feed and cloth their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloths and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 6 children. Jaime supports his family through fishing. He hopes to increase his income and be able to sustain his children's education. Jaime plans to use his loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. This will help bring in more fish for Jaime to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells doughnuts, which she has done for 6 years. Joyce is married and has 4 children.   She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees.  Joyce will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts

loans.name: Abdela

texts.en: Abdela is a shoe maker. He makes and repairs shoes, which he has done for 10 years.  Abdela is married and has 5 children. He uses his income to pay his children’s school fees.  Abdela will use his loan to purchase leather to make shoes.  With the new profit, he wishes to purchase a machine to speed up his work.

loans.use: to purchase leather to make shoes

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en: This is 28yrs- old Abu- Bakarr.  He is married, and has no child.  In 2009, Abu- Bakarr established his Jeans, Bags, Shoes etc. business. He began his business because he lost his Father who was paying his school fees for him to be able to take care of him self. Working 7 days a week and 10hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4, 000,000. Abu- Bakarr requires a loan in order to buy 4 dozens men's jean @ Le 600,000, 3 dozens ladies bag @ Le 480,000 and the balance Le 160,000 to be used as transport. In the future, Abu- Bakarr plans to get a better business, and start selling whole sales and hopes to live a better life with his family.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 4 dozens men's jean @ Le 600,000, 3 dozens ladies bag @ Le 480,000 and the balance Le 160,000 to be used as transport.

loans.name: Cirilo Marcelo

texts.es:
Cirilo nació en Colombia en 1968, pero actualmente reside en la parroquia de Rio Verde en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo tiene un clima tropical húmedo y varia de 18°C y llega a  casi 38°C.  Santo Domingo es el hogar ancestral de los Tsáchilas, que son un grupo étnico que vive en este lugar desde antes de la época colonial y aún mantiene tradición tales como el vestuario y sus creencias. La ciudad está ubicada entre la sierra y la costa y juega un papel importante ya que su localización le hace el enlace de varias ciudades ecuatorianas haciendo de Santo Domingo un punto preciso para el comercio Ecuatoriano. Es más, Santo Domingo abarca la mayoría del mercado ganadero en el Ecuador.  
Cirilo es un hombre soltero y tiene dos hijos, un de 6 años y otro de 8 años de edad. Él se dedica más de 8 horas al día a un negocio de crianza y venta de pollos que estableció hace 3 años. Él ya tiene experiencia en este trabajo desde hace varios años, ya que aprendió de trabajos anteriores. Cirilo solicita un crédito a Kiva para agrandar su negocio incrementando el número de pollos; esto es algo que puede hacer gracias a que su capacidad instalada la permite ya que en el criadero puede tener más pollos. Al aumentar las ganancias de su negocio mejorará sus ingresos y estilo de vida. De esta manera, Cirilo podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos y dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Cirilo was born in Colombia in 1968, but currently resides in Rio Verde parish in the city of Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo has a humid tropical climate with temperatures varying from 18°C  to nearly 38°C.  Santo Domingo is the ancestral home of the Tsáchilas, which is an ethnic group that has been living in this place since before the colonial era, and still maintains traditions such as their mode of dress and their beliefs.

The city is located between the mountains and the coast. It plays an important role, as its location makes it the link between several Ecuadorian cities, making Santo Domingo an indispensable location for Ecuadorian commerce. Furthermore, Santo Domingo encompasses the majority of the livestock market in Ecuador. 
  
Cirilo is single, and has two children: a six-year-old and an 8-year-old.  He works more than eight hours a day in his business raising and selling chickens, that he set up three years ago. He already has several years experience in this work, as he learned it from previous jobs.
