With the increased income he will be able to reinvest in family agricultural business to expand it and make more profitable. As a result Sopiko and Leri will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to change the tires of her family's tractor

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposo al sur de la ciudad  y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 22 y 26 años. Ella  se dedica a la venta de mercancías por catálogos o guías especializadas a través de las cuales ofrece sus productos como ropa y calzado en las líneas  femenina, masculina e infantil. Denis inició su negocio con el ánimo de generar  ingresos, pues no lograba encontrar un empleo y el trabajo independiente le dio esa posibilidad, a partir de su hoy actividad comercial. Su meta es llegar a ser líder de zona  y aunque ha estado muy cera de hacerlo, la edad de su madre le ha requerido mucha atención, pero aun sueña con lograr este propósito, porque con esta actividad ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos. Su credikiva es su primer financiamiento que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara calzado femenino y mercancía, que sus catálogos exhiben con descuentos especiales y ella quiere impactar a sus clientes con cosméticos, perfumería al alcance de su bolsillo y esta es justamente la razón por la cual su credikiva se muestra como una inversión exitosa. Su principal meta se dirige  a que sus hijos logren finalizar estudios universitarios, para potencializar su éxito personal y familiar; así  su principal desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a una clientela que la espera con la demanda de muchos artículos, que aunque Denis les vende,   no lo hace de manera oportuna, porque espera recuperar el dinero de sus cuentas por cobrar para dar curso a sus pedidos.
texts.en: Denis is 51 years old. She lives with her husband in the southern part of town, and she has two children aged 22 and 26. She sells merchandise from catalogs or specialized guides through which she offers her products such as women's, men's and children's clothing and shoes. Denis started her business with the drive to get an income, because she wasn't able to find a job. Self-employment made that possible for her through what is currently her business. Her aim is to become the leader of her area and although she has come very close to achieving that, her mother's health has required a lot of attention. However, she still dreams of reaching that goal, because through this business she has been able to support her children's well-being. Her Kiva loan is the first loan she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase women's shoes and products featured in her catalogs at special discounts. She wants to make an impact on her customers with cosmetics and perfumery they can afford, and that's exactly the reason why her Kiva loan appears to be a successful investment. Her main goal is aimed towards her children being able to finish college, so they can boost their success, both on a personal and on a family level. Therefore, her main challenge is not having enough working capital to serve a clientele that awaits her with orders for many items. Although Denis sells these items, she doesn't do it in a timely fashion, because she waits to collect the money from the payments that are due before she places the orders.

loans.use: to purchase womens's shoes and products featured in her catalogs at special discounts, such as cosmetics and perfumery.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor lives in Aguada, Ozamis City. He earns by providing transportation services, which he has done for 2 years, in order to support the needs of his child. He gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 45-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his child successfully studying. Without hesitation, Nestor borrows the amount of 13,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He joined GDMPC in 2007. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergent and beverages

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 48 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. Florencia used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Melalyn

texts.en: Melalyn is 43 years old and married with 7 children. Melalyn works hard to provide for her family. She sells tobacco in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. Melalyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling tobacco for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. Melalyn aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
Dora María, integrante del grupo Cielo Azul, esta muy agradecida por la invitación de sus vecinas a este crédito grupal para invertir en su mercería y material para manualidades temáticas. 
Ella es madre de dos hijos, y hace tiempo tuvo la visión de hacer negocio con una actividad de esparcimiento que tiene para sus tiempos libres, las manualidades. Después, creció esta idea al comprar mercancía para establecer una mercería, todavía pequeña, pero que provee artículos básicos de este genero a sus clientes.
Ella esta muy contenta de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio pues esto le ha permitido ser ejemplo para su  familia ejemplo de divertirse trabajando.
texts.en:
Dora María, member of the group Cielo Azul, is very grateful for the invitation from her neighbors to this loan group to invest in her craft store and craft supplies.  

She is the mother of two, and for a while she dreamt of turning her leisure activity - crafts - into a business.  Later, she developed this idea to buy merchandise to open a craft store.  Although it is still small, it provides basic craft materials to her customers.

She is very content to continue investing in her business since this has allowed her to be an example to her family that one can enjoy what he or she does for a living.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for the craft supply store and crafts.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Joy is married and has two children. To make a living, she provides school services in the local community. She has been in her business for 5 years and earns 30,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase school supplies such as paper, chalk, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies such as paper, chalk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON and NATASHA

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 41 años de edad vive en el Municipio de Soledad desde el cual se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, actividad para la que se preparó en procesos de capacitación,  desde el año 1994   y desde el 1996 emprendió su aventura de negocios, haciendo prendas sencillas para sus amigos y familiares a quienes les  confeccionaba a la medida y ellos llevaban sus telas e insumos, de esta manera ella solo ofrecía el servicio de costura. Poco a poco fue perfeccionando su arte y aumentaron sus clientes y así mismo, Gloria empezó a comprar la materia prima y a vender entre su clientela que cada día aumentaba. Desde hace dos años, aprovechando su potencial de ventas, adicionó una actividad comercial mediante la cual vende productos que promociona  con guías especializadas, alternando esta actividad con su antiguo negocio de confecciones y con ambas genera ingresos paralelos  para el sustento de su hogar  tres hijos en las edades de 18 a 21 años. Su meta es ampliar su taller de confecciones y obtener contratos con los que logre ingresos superiores a los actuales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos y materias primas para confeccionar nuevos diseños, y mercancías variadas.  Con esta inversión aumentará su cartera de clientes así como también sus ventas se verán beneficiadas produciendo nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41, and lives in the municipality of Soledad. Here she works as a dressmaker making clothing, work that she prepared for through training programs, beginning in 1994. In 1996 she launched her business venture, making simple articles of clothing for her friends and family members that she made to measure. They brought her their fabric and supplies. In this way, she only offered sewing services.

She gradually perfected her skill and increased her clientele. As well, Gloria began to buy raw materials and to sell amongst her clientele, which increased  each day. 

Two years ago, taking advantage of its sales potential, she added a commercial activity through which she sells products she promotes with specialized catalogs, alternating this activity with her old business of dressmaking. With both she generates parallel income streams for supporting her household of three children, ages 18 to 21.

Her goal is to expand her dressmaking workshop and obtain contracts through which she will achieve higher revenues than she currently gets.

Now she is applying for a credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this she will buy supplies and raw materials for sewing new designs, as well as a variety of merchandise. With this investment, she will increase her portfolio of customers, and as well, her sales will benefit, producing new income.

loans.use: To buy supplies and raw materials for making new designs, as well as a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant rice-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell for her ambulant rice-vending business.

Mema has been in this business for eight years. Mema earns more income from farming rice.

Mema has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Estela Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Estela Margarita esta casada, tiene 24 años de edad, esta graduada de bachiller en ciencias y letras, se dedica al tricotado de hilos, lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es auxiliar de auditoria.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos, para aumentar su producción de hilo en tricotado, espera en le futuro tener amplio capital y conseguir mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Estela Margarita is a married 24 year old and has a bachelor's in science and grammar.  She makes a living by knitting yarn and has two years of experience.   She has the support of her husband who assists with the accounting.

She is seeking a loan which she will use to purchase yarn in order to increase knitting production.  In the future, she hopes to have ample capital and higher profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies for knitting

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 57 years old and married with one child who is in school. Merlyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Merlyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, shampoo, toothpaste, etc.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 31 years old and is married with two children.

Rocel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Rocel has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling feeds.

Rocel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Edith

texts.es: Nancy de 59 años de edad es una mujer casada, madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 33 a 40 años; ella desde hace más de 20 años, se dedica a la actividad comercial, la cual inició con el fin de apoyar la gestión de ingresos de su esposo en el hogar. Así viajando a Panamá, en donde compra perfumes, ropa, bolsos y los comercializa en diversos barrios de la ciudad. Sus principales clientes son mujeres aunque también cuenta con personal masculino. Su mayor sueño es tener un almacén con ropa importada de Panamá, país vecino de Colombia, por lo cual debe tener mucho más dinero para realizar sus compras. En la actualidad sus indicadores financieros, muestran una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 38 días, una rotación de mercancías de 2 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 40%, lo que muestra un negocio con mucho potencial de crecimiento, aunque su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr responder con muchos mas productos a un mercado que la espera para comprarle. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara principalmente perfumería, ropa y calzado. Con ello impactará a su clientela con diversas modas en diseños y aromas originales traídos al atravesar el océano Atlántico y llegar a Panamá.
texts.en:
Nancy is 59, and a married woman. She is the mother of four children, ages 33 to 40. For more than 20 years she has been a merchant, an activity she began with the aim of helping her husband with the household expenses. She does this by travelling to Panama, where she buys perfumes, clothing and bags, and sells them in various neighborhoods of the city. Her main customers are women, although she also sells to men.

Her greatest dream is to have a store with clothing imported from Panama, the country that neighbors Colombia. For this she must have a great deal more money in order to carry out her purchases.  

Currently her financial indicators show turnover of accounts receivable at 38 days, turnover of merchandise at two days, and return on sales of not less than 40%. This shows a business with considerable potential for growth, even though her greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital to respond with many more products to a market that is waiting to buy them from her. 

This is why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which she will buy mainly perfume, clothing and footwear. With this, she will impress her clientele with various fashion designs and original aromas, brought across the Atlantic Ocean to Panama.

loans.use: To buy mainly perfume, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Jiparkul

texts.ru:
Жыпаркул – лидер группы «Актан», ей 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. Жыпаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 13 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Жыпаркул приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян моркови и капусты.  Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Jiparkul is the leader of the Aktan group. She is 38 years old, married, and raising five children. Thirteen years ago, as the sole income earner for her family,  Jiparkul began raising livestock and farming. This business, started with 20,000 som (KGS) in capital, today earns her around 12,000 som (KGS) a month. With the goal of further developing her business Jiparkul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 30,000 som (KGS) loan to buy carrot and cabbage seeds. She plans to invest the revenue earned into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase carrot and cabbage seeds

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DINAMICO,la socia tiene 49 años ,soltera y tiene 1 hijo,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de tickets de tren,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria  vendiendo a los turistas que requieren ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tickets de tren.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank DINAMICO.  She is 49 years old, single, and has one son. She alternates her daily activities between buying and selling train tickets.  She works as a kind of travelling saleswoman, selling to those tourists who need tickets.  She is a happy and responsible person with a strong desire to continue working for her family.  She is asking for the loan to buy train tickets.  She is very grateful for the loan provided and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy train tickets.

loans.name: Nelly Marisol

texts.es:
Nelly Marisol tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.

Nelly Marisol se  dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la venta de víveres. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, fertilizantes.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá sembrar maíz con semilla certificada.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace cada 6 meses. El sueño es poder sembrar cacao y café. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de insumos a los cultivos.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar
texts.en:
Nelly Marisol is 38 years old and is married with three children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the VRC "LUCHA Y PROGRESO," whose members are involved in agriculture, and who all live in the area surrounding Progreso and have practically all been brought up in this area.

Nelly Marisol works in agriculture and grows corn, and also sells agricultural supplies.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy urea, seeds, and fertilizers.  With the aid of this loan, she will be able to plant corn from certified seeds.

The buying and selling is something she has been doing every six months.  Her dream is to be able to plant cacao and coffee plants.  The hardships she has faced are the lack of agricultural inputs for her plots.  In her free time, she likes to travel.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal DINAMICO;la socia tiene 64 años ,viuda y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa y productos de belleza ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su  mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y familiares,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes y colonias para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the community bank "DINAMICO."  She is 64 years old, and a widow, with 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities between her clothing sales business and her beauty products business.  She works on foot, showing her products to the customers who ask her for them, such as her friends and relatives.  She is a responsible person, with a desire to keep working for her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy perfumes and colognes for her business.  She feels quite thankful for the loan she's been given, and she promises to pay back her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and colognes for her business.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Don Pascual tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y tiene 15 hijos. Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era un niño, fue su padre quien le enseño. De esta forma don Pascual ha podido brindarle lo necesario a su familia, la mayoría de sus hijos ya están formando su propio hogar y actualmente solo vive con cinco hijos, su esposa y su mamá. Él tiene deseos de enseñar este oficio a sus últimos hijos, que en este momento están estudiando.

Los insumos que necesita los compra en una ciudad que esta a unos doce kilómetros de su casa; el acceso a este lugar es difícil, solo llega un autobús dos días a la semana, por esa razón debe estar pendiente a la llegada del autobús para realizar todas sus compras, porque de lo contrario debe pagar a una persona que le brinde los servicios de trasporte en un vehiculo y este le resulta mas costoso que viajar en autobús.

Don Pascual invertirá el préstamo que esta solicitando para comprar abono, herbicidas y fertilizantes para cultivar maíz y fríjol. Así él comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez para obtener un poco de ahorro; debido a que realizara un solo viaje. También, aplicara todos los insumos que necesita en el tiempo justo, pues teniéndolo en su casa le ayudara para trasladarlo hasta la zona donde tiene cultivado.

Él desea que todos sus esfuerzos por obtener una buena cosecha sean bien aprovechados, espera recibir un buena cantidad de granos, venderlos a un precio bueno en el mercado, para comprar el alimento para su familia y que sus hijos crezcan sanos. Así como tiene el deseo de que sus hijos aprendan el trabajo de la agricultura y sus ventajas para que se desempeñen de una manera optima.
texts.en:
Don Pascual is 58, married, and has 15 children. He has farmed since he was a child, as it was his father who taught him.  In this way, Pascual has been able to provide for his family's needs. The majority of his children are already starting their own households, and currently he only lives with five children, his wife and his mother. He wishes to teach this occupation to his youngest children, who are in school at this time.

He buys the supplies he needs in a city that is some 12 kilometers from his home; access to this location is difficult, a bus only comes two days a week. That is why he has to await the arrival of the bus in order to carry out all his purchases; because otherwise he must pay a person who offers transport services in a vehicle, and this is more expensive than travelling by bus.

Pascual will use the loan he is requesting, in order to buy organic and other fertilizers, as well as herbicides, for growing corn and beans. This way he will buy all the supplies at once to save a bit of money, due to the fact that he will make only one trip. Also, he will apply all the agricultural inputs he needs to, and at the right time, as having them at his home will help him transport them to the area that he has under cultivation.

He wishes all his efforts to obtain a good harvest to be well-spent. He hopes to get good-sized crop, to sell at a good price in the market, in order to buy food for his family and so that his children grow up healthy. As well, he wishes for his children to learn farming and its advantages so that they can do it in the best way possible.

loans.use: To buy organic and other fertilizers, as well as herbicides, for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Это уже не первый кредит КИВА, которым пользуется Василь. Оставшись очень довольным качеством полученных услуг, Василь смог не только приготовить свое транспортное средство к дальнейшей работе, проделав нужные сварочные и покрасочные работы, но за счет полученной прибыли сделал также дома небольшой ремонт, приобрел некоторую мебель, застеклил балкон.   

Василь планирует приобрести автомобиль Мерседес 123 1984 года и поставить его на таксовку. На данный момент его тесть работает на него, предоставляя транспортные услуги на арендованном автомобиле. Василь планирует посадить своего тесть за руль новоприобретенного авто и теперь уже работать на своем транспорте. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
This is not Vasiliy's first loan from Kiva. Having been very satisfied at the quality of the services received Vasiliy was able to not only ready his vehicle for further service, but having completed the needed welding and painting he was able to use revenue received to give his home a small remodeling by getting a few pieces of furniture and glassing in the balcony. 

Vasiliy plans to buy a 1984 Mercedes 123 and use it as a taxi. His father-in-law is currently working on it, while providing transportation services with a rented vehicle. Vasiliy plans to put his father in law behind the wheel of the new car and is already working on his own transportation.

loans.use: buy a 1984 Mercedes 123 and make it into a taxi

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DINAMICO,la socia tiene 42 años ,casada y 4 hijos,la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable y carismatica con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas verduras como zanahoria y zapallo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the community bank "DINAMICO," and she is 42 years old, married, and with four children.  She varies her daily activities with the business of buying and selling vegetables.  She has been in this business and doing well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She is a responsible and charismatic person with the will to continue working for her family's good.

This woman is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables, like carrots and pumpkins.  She feels thankful for the loan that has been given and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, like carrots and pumpkins.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia has a kiosk in a town. She lives in the market so it is easy for people to come to buy her things. She is making good income. She feels better when she opens this kiosk because she can make money every day.

loans.use: To buy candles, biscuits, and oil to sell

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 helps Guilhermina to run her business better. She lives near a town and often comes to the town to buy more things to keep in her store and sell.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, oil, and other things to sell

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is selling clothes, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help her to buy more clothes to sell. She is making good income from selling clothes. With the income, she can manage to pay for some of her family's needs and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en: Jeni is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more clothes. She makes a good income. She uses her income to buy things that they need in her family. With the loan, she has a dream of making a bigger place to sell clothes in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, aged 47, is married with five children and lives in Mialen, Clarin. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Gemma has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional pig feed. Gemma has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 38 years old and lives in Lam-an, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three children. Mary Grace operates a food vending business to earn a living. She has a small food stall at the market where she sells food items, snacks and refreshments. She has been running her business for five years and earns PHP 20,000 each month from this business. 

Mary Grace has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to have a food court in the city and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 32 years old and married with two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making pastries, cookies and bread

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Olesya

texts.ru:
Олеся – из курортного города Бердянск на азовском море. Она уже 19 лет занимается предпринимательством, работая в торговле. Олеся торгует женской одеждой и аксессуарами в одном из местных торговых центров, арендуя помещение для работы. В ее торговой точке представлен большой ассортимент товара, который пользуется хорошим спросом у покупателя.  

Олесе необходим кредит в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и пополнить оборотные средства, а именно закупить сарафаны и бижутерию, которые в этом сезоне особенно популярны среди ее покупательниц. В будущем Олеся планирует расширять свое торговое место, что и стимулирует ее вкладывать в свое дело и развиваться по мере возможности.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Olesya comes trom the resort town of Berdyansk on Azov sea. She has been working in retail for 19 years. Olesya sells women's clothes and accessories at one of the local shopping centers, where she rents her sale space. Her store offers a variety of clothes for her customers and is very popular. Olesya wants to take out a loan of 10,000 griven to expand her inventory and have more cash on hand for purchases. Specifically she plans to purchase sundresses and accessories which are popular with her clients during this season. In the future Olesya plans to expand her store and for this reason is very motivated to invest in her business and develop it as much as she can.

loans.use: to purchase sundresses and accessories

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il travaille dans le secteur du transport en commun. Depuis plus de 5 ans il est chauffeur de taxi. Il est sociétaire dans le guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité d’habitation ou il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs cfa. Ce prêt servira à acquérir une chambre à coucher afin d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.  Toutefois son projet futuriste est de devenir propriétaire d’une compagnie de taxi afin qu’il puisse  maximiser les revenus que lui procureront son activité, ce qui lui donnera l’opportunité d’ améliorer les conditions de vie ainsi que le bien- être de sa famille.
texts.en: Abdou lives in Senegal and is married with two children. He works in the public transport field and has been a taxi driver for more than five years. He is a member/shareholder of the U-IMCEC branch in his town and is requesting a loan of 250,000FCFA. This loan will be used to acquire a bedroom so that he can improve his family's living conditions. His future ambition is, however, to become the owner of a taxi company so that he can maximise the income which he generates from his business. This will give him the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions as well as their well-being.

loans.use: to acquire a bedroom for his household.

loans.name: N'tsame

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités et cartes de recharge depuis 2007, Madame N’tsame est mariée à un enseignant et ont ensemble 02 enfants âgés de 12 et 07ans qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce son activité dans une boutique à toutes personnes. Sa difficulté est la rupture de stock et elle sollicite ce quatrième crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer l’éducation des enfants et aider son mari dans les charges du ménage.
texts.en: N'tsame has been selling basic food products and telephone recharge cards since 2007. She is married to a teacher and they have two children, who are 12 and seven years old respectively; both children are at school. She get her supplies in Lomé and carries out her activity in a shop, selling to all sorts of people. Her problem is a lack of stock and she is requesting this fourth loan from WAGES so that she can buy more goods and respond better to customer demand. She wants to reinvest in her business, provide for her children's education and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 53 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Remedios is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She has been buying and selling livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from rice farming. Remedios is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Akovi

texts.fr: Né en 1970, Mr Akovi a pour profession frigoriste. Il a ouvert son atelier depuis 2000 dans lequel il répare les frigidaires et vend en même temps des appareils de froid à toutes personnes dans le besoin. Il est aidé par 01 personne et sa difficulté est le manque de fonds pour répondre aux besoins de clients. Vu qu’il maitrise bien son travail, il est sollicité partout c’est pour cela il vient  auprès  de WAGES pour avoir son sixième  prêt afin d’acheter des appareils de froid et mieux satisfaire ses clients. Notons qu’il est père de 02 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 05ans et que sa conjointe est couturière. Il veut dans l’avenir élargir son activité et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akovi, who was born in 1970, is a refrigeration technician by trade. He opened his workshop in 2000 and he repairs refrigerators here and at the same time sells cold storage equipment to anyone who needs it. He is helped out by one person and his main problem is a lack of funds to be able to respond to customer demand. Since he manages his work well, he is in great demand and for this reason he has approached WAGES for a sixth loan so he can buy cold storage equipment and satisfy his customer demand more easily. It should be noted that he is father to two children who are both at school. The eldest is ten years old and the youngest five; his wife is a seamstress. In the future he wants to expand his business and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy cold storage equipment.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four children. Arlyn is a fisherman, catching fish to earn a living. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns PHP 4,000 each month from this activity. 

Arlyn has requested a loan of PHP 7,400 from GDMPC to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.ru:
Анатолий живет с семьей в  селе Великая Знаменка, Запорожской области в Украине. Начали с женой заниматься бизнесом с 2002г. В начале торговали пленкой с прицепа, затем в ларьке семенами,  а потом уже  арендовали магазин.  На сегодняшний день имеют 3 магазина, один в с. Великая Знаменка и два в Каменке. В магазинах много товара: удобрения, химикаты, семена, пленка, с/х техника.  Товар пользуется спросом, есть постоянные клиенты. Анатолий  вместе с женой много трудятся  и поэтому имеют  хорошие результаты. Бизнес успешный, они не останавливаются на достигнутом, совершенствуются, постоянно расширяют свой бизнес.

Анатолий планирует вложить кредит в 20 000 гривен, полученный от КИВА в закупку товара: нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы увеличить объемы продукции. Анатолий имеет сельскохозяйственное образование, есть опыт в этой сфере деятельности. В летний период в этом регионе особенный спрос на удобрения и химикаты, поэтому Анатолий старается для своих покупателей приобрести самый качественный товар и чтобы в нем не было недостатка.
texts.en:
Anatoliy lives in Velikaya Znamenka in the Zaporozhski region of Ukraine. He started a business with his wife in 2002. In the beginning they were selling plastic sheeting from a truck, then started a market stall where they sold seeds and then finally were able to rent a store space of their own. Currently the two own three stores, one in Velikaya Znamenka and two others in Kamenka. Their store sells agricultural goods and equipment: fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, plastic sheeting for greenhouses etc. Their store is popular and has regular clients. Anatoliy and his wife work hard and because of that are successful. They are not planning to stop and want to always improve and expand their business.

Anatoliy wants to invest 20,000 griven from Kiva by purchasing additional goods for sale. He has an agricultural degree and a lot of experience in this profession. In the summer season there is a lot of demand for fertilizer and pesticide in the regions, and Anatoliy wants to be sure to buy quality products in sufficient amounts so that his clients have everything they wish to buy on hand.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of goods for sale

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru: Муаттар жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках за границей. Сама Муаттар у себя дома занимается шитьем. В этой области она имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Muattar lives in Istaravshan. She is 31 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is working abroad. Muattar herself works as a seamsters from home. She has a lot of experience. She is taking this loan to purchase more fabrics for her to sew with.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Jonalyn has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her shop. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her welding shop

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is single and has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines. Rowena has been in this business for five years. 

Rowena has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bamboo to sell

loans.name: Pedro Nicasio

texts.es:
PEDRO NICASIO tiene 41 años de edad es soltero tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.

PEDRO NICASIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la semilla buena. Las compras lo hará en ventanas. El sueño es poder arrendar terreno. Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo la orosco. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Nicasio is 41 years old. He has four children, and he lives with the children and his wife in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the "Lucha y Progreso" ("Fight to Progress") communal bank, whose members work in agriculture ind live in the surrounding area - they say that "Progress was practically born there". 

Pedro Nicasio grows maize. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, pesticides, nitrogen fertilizer, and liquid weedkiller. With the help of the loan he can buy the best seed, which he will buy in Ventanas. His dream is to lease some more land. The setbacks he is likely to face are pests such as orosco. In his spare time Pedro Nicasio enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, nitrogen fertilizer, and liquid weedkiller.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки летних халатов. Летний бизнес идет хорошшо, спрос на халаты увеличивается и Надежде нужно закупить дополнительную партию товара, чтобы не упустить возможность получить дополнительную прибыль. 

Надежда активный предприниматель, который постоянно находится в поиске и оценке новых возможностей для бизнеса. Недавно она начала развивать новое для себя направление - продажа туристических путевок. Несмотря на то, что в этом бизнесе очень высокая конкуренция, Надежда надеется привлекать клиентов за счет скидок и гибкой ценовой политики.
texts.en: Nadezhda asks for a loan to purchase a batch of light summer robes for resale. Summer business is always good and there is a lot of demand for light summer robes. Nadezhda wants to purchase a batch of this clothing type to that she can capitalize on the demand and earn additional profits. Nadezhda is a active businesswoman who is always looking for new ways to improve and develop her business. Recently she branched out into a new area - sale of resort travel packages. Despite the fact that there is a lot of competition in the area Nadezhda hopes to attract clients with sale specials and flexible payment options.

loans.use: to purchase summer robes

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is from Taguma, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old and is married with one child. Domingo manages a coconut production business. He has been in his business for three years and earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Domingo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 34,400 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 38 years old and is single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Daisy aspires to save money to expand her business and to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas used his previous loan to buy home products such as kitchen plates, buckets, plastic jugs, basins, etc. to sell in his shop. It was profitable and he was able to repay all of the loan amount.

This will be his second loan and he plans to buy more bags of sugar and rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil. He also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy educational materials such as books,  files, school bags and pens to sell in his retail shop.

Douglas hopes to grow his business and to be able to buy land and build a house for his family as well as to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil, as well as educational materials to sell

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cora works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Cora is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: To buy materials for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 27 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Evelyn runs an ambulant vending business which involves walking around selling household products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Evelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more household products to sell

loans.name: Lanie Jean

texts.en:
Lanie Jean is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 21 years old, is married and has one child. Lanie Jean used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her business has grown and has become successful. 

Now, she is taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 34 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Genelyn runs an ambulant vending business which involves walking around selling household products in the Philippines. She has been running this business for seven years and also earns an income from selling dry goods and school supplies.

Genelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household products to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. Genelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional household products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Callei Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias  y trabajar juntas. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus hijos, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Juana es parte de este grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás. Cuenta que tiene ya muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene su negocio bien abastecido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás insumos para poder surtir su local con todo tipo de bebidas. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of Caacupé have come together with the objective of helping their families and working together. They are women who head their households and who fight so that their children will have a better future and will never know the deprivation that they had to endure.

Juana is part of this group and she relates that she sells all types of drinks, such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and others. She says that she has a very good clientele because her business is always well-supplied.

She is requesting this loan to buy sodas, wine, beer, and other products to stock her store with all types of beverages. Her goal is to be able to continue to grow and thus to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jocelyn runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for two years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Meteur

texts.en:
Meteur is a cash crop farmer in Nakuru town and has been in the business for four years.  He mostly plants maize as well as beans and bananas.  He is 50 years old, married to Nemama, and has six children.

This will be Meteur's fourth loan, and he plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.  He also plans to use part of it to pay the farm workers.  Being a rainy season, he hopes to make more profit, with which he plans to buy more cattle for dairy farming.

In the future, he hopes to invest in large-scale farming and to improve the living standards of his family as well as provide employment to other people in his area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and married with eight children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from food vending.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos niños de 9 y 15 años de edad, vive en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de carteras y bolsones, tiene tres años en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia,  para poder trabajar y ofrecer a su familia los ingresos para solventar algunas necesidades básicas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una variedad de carteras y bolsones, que le permita surtir el negocio y aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, esperando que sean aceptados y que aumente la afluencia de clientes.
La aspiración de Olga es mejorar económicamente con el negocio, para poder apoyar a sus hijos en la educación, ofreciéndoles las herramientas para superarse.
texts.en:
Olga, 38, is the mother of two children ages 9 and 15, and owns her own home. She sells wallets and bags and has done so for 3 years. She started this business on her own initiative in order to have work and provide her family an income to cover the basic necessities. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of wallets and purses, which would allow her to stock her business and increase the amount of merchandise she has to offer her clients. She hopes that the merchandise would be appreciated and can increase the influx of customers. Olga’s goal is to use the business to improve her finances so she can provide for her children’s education and offer them the tools to succeed.

loans.use: purchase a variety of wallets and bags

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en:
Nolie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Nolie has been in this business for 9 years. Nolie earns additional income from farming rice.

Nolie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Nora has been in this business for one year.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies.

Rebecca has been farming flowers for 15 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other supplies.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nieva is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nieva has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nieva requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

Nieva has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nieva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad Omar

texts.en:
Mohamad Omar is a 41-year-old married man, the father of four children. He has been working as a carpenter for 30 years. Mohamad Omar was very young when he started working: he was only 11 years old when he started, but he had to help his family to make their living. 

Today he owns his big well-known working place which he has to take good care of in order to ensure it keeps improving. Mohamad Omar applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood for his business, to be ready for new requested projects. 

He hopes to keep on accepting more projects to provide his family with good living standards.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood for his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer in Olkalau town where she plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. From the income, she has been able to provide for her family's needs. She is 46 years old and married to Benson who is also a farmer.

This will be her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer and pesticides for use in her farm. With the anticipated income she plans to improve her farming methods by planting more cash crops.

In the future Lucy hopes to grow her farming business and make more income hence be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish business.

Rowena has been in this business for 23 years. Rowena earns additional income from electronic re-loading.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a married woman who has two children. Josefa is 43 years old, and resides at Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines. Josefa owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She's been 10 years in this business and each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,400 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Josefa joined GDMPC. In the future, Josefa wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Edith Lisseth

texts.es:
Edith, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y pupusas, vive con su madre, residen en casa propia, tambien Edith trabaja a medio tiempo como empleada, ella inicio el negocio hace 5 años con el apoyo de su madre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos  para las meriendas y las pupusas, el aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, entre otros que son muy necesarios para el buen funcionamiento del negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener un negocio rentable y con más variedad para las ventas.
La aspiración de Edith es tener un local adecuado para el negocio, donde pueda atender mejor a los clientes y atraer a nuevas personas.
texts.en:
Edith's business is selling afternoon snacks and pupusas.  She lives with her mother in a home that they own.  Edith also works part time as an employee.  She started her business five years ago with her mother's support.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her snacks and pupsas: oil, seasonings, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (cooked pork), corn and other items that are really necessary to run her business well.  This loan will help her to maintain a profitable business and offer more variety in her sales.

Edith's aspiration is to have well-equipped premises for her business where she can better serve her customers and attract new people.

loans.use: to buy oil, seasonings, soft cheese, cooked pork and corn

loans.name: Rudy Cesar

texts.es:
Rudy, se dedica a la agricultura, vive acompañado de su esposa, no tiene hijos, pero alrededor viven un hermano y su madre, el proceso de la agricultura lo aprendió desde pequeño con su padre, esto le ha ayudado para tener una ocupación de la que puede generar para su familia el alimento y cubrir otras necesidades a través de la comercialización de la cosechas.
El solicita un préstamo, porque está iniciando el proceso de la siembra para un nuevo cultivo de maíz, se comprara semilla mejorada, abono, pesticidas,  que son necesarios para prevenir el cultivo de las plagas y mejorar la producción, este préstamo le ayudara brindándole los recursos económicos para tener todo lo necesario.
La aspiración de Rudy es mejorar su cultivos, crecer en la producción, por medio de este trabajo tambien mejorar su vivienda, porque es de adobe y a futuro quiere mejorar sus paredes.
texts.en:
Rudy is a farmer, and he lives with his wife. They don’t have children, but his mother and brother live nearby. He has learned about farming from his father since he was small, which has allowed him to have an occupation. He uses the money he earns from selling his harvest to pay for food and other needs of his family. 
He is requesting the loan because he has started the process of sowing a new crop of corn. He wants to purchase improved seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, which are necessary to prevent pests and increase his yield. This loan will provide him with the financial resources to have everything he needs. Rudy’s goals are to improve his crops and grow his production. Through his work, he also hopes to be able to improve his home. It is made out of adobe and he wants to improve his walls in the future.

loans.use: Purchase improved seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es:
William, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica al trabajo en un taller de reparación de bicicletas, aprendió el negocio como una necesidad para poder mantener a su familia, llevándole los ingresos necesarios, lo realiza desde el 2009.
El está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para las bicicletas como pedales, cadenas, rayos, asientos, también comprara herramientas para realizar las reparaciones, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ya que le dará mayor estabilidad para atender a la clientela y mejorar las ganancias.
El objetivo de William es mejorar la capacidad del taller, a futuro quiere también mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, específicamente reparar el piso.
texts.en:
William lives with his wife and child.  He has a bike repair shop and learned this business through necessity as he needed to support his family, providing them with the income they need.  He has been in the business since 2009.

William is requesting a loan to invest in buying bike parts such as pedals, chains, spokes and seats.  He will also buy tools for making his repairs.  This loan will help him to improve his business because it will give him more stability for attending to his customers and improving his profits.

William's aim is to improve the capacity of his workshop.  In the future, he would also like to improve the conditions of his home, in particular repairing his floor.

loans.use: to buy pedals, chains, spokes and seats

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mburucuya” es un comité de 14 mujeres que están muy bien consolidadas, trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen siempre para brindarse apoyo en sus esfuerzos de mejorar su situación económica.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es Carmen, quien se dedica a la peluquería. Tiene un negocio con lo mínimo que se necesita para poder hacer bien su trabajo, es gracias a su negocio que puede mantener y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de spray, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, peines y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y así poder seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes,
texts.en:
The “Mburucuya” community bank is a very strong committee of 14 women who work and help each other out.  These ladies are from the city of Villarrica and they are all friends and neighbors.  They always meet up to lend each other support in their joint efforts to improve their financial situation.

One of the members of this group is Carmen who is a hairdresser.  She has a business with the minimum equipment she needs to be able to do her work well.  Thanks to her business, she is able to support and help her family.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy hairspray, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, combs and other supplies so that she can stock her business and thereby be able to continue providing a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hairspray, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, combs and other supplies

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, vive con una hermana, ella tiene dos años de estar vendiendo  la ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa en variedad de blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad del negocio, aumentando la variedad  para su clientela, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para ella y su negocio.
La aspiración de Ana es mejorar el negocio, crecer en clientela, ya que de esta manera estará asegurándose una mejor estabilidad con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothes as a street vendor. She is 21 years old and a single mother of a 2 year old child. She lives with her sister and has been selling clothes for two years. She started this business on her own out of the need to have a source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, and and underwear. This investment will help her to improve her business' stock, offering her customers more income. This loan will be a big help for her and her business. 

Ana aspires to improving her business and growing her clientele. This way she will ensure more stability for her son.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: Carla Vanesa casada, con 37 años de edad con dos hijos tiene por actividad económica  la venta de mercadería en general, ella inicio como una necesidad para satisfacer la necesidades de sus hijos, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años, en la actualidad ha demostrado que ha sido su medio de subsistencia y que lo ha sabido administrar, el financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en la compra de ropa, útiles escolares, cosméticos, zapatos entre otros.
texts.en: Carla Vanesa is married. She is 37 years old and has two children. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. She started out of the need to provide for her children. She has had the business for 3 years. Right now she has demonstrated that she her business is viable and that she knows how to manage it. The loan she is asking for is to invest in buying clothes, school supplies, cosmetics, shoes and more.

loans.use: to buy clothing, school supplies, cosmetics, shoes and more.

loans.name: Juan Abel

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura  sembrado maíz, chile y frijol, tiene seis años de trabajar en lo propio, aprendió de su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, hasta el momento cuenta con mucha experiencia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales que invertirá en el cultivo, los cuales son el abono, herbicidas, foliares y semilla de maíz, con este préstamo lograra tener todo lo necesario para prevenir el cultivo de las plagas y fortalecer la producción.
El objetivo de Juan es trabajar fuerte, para poder mejorar sus cultivos, asi como mejorar su condición familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family.  He has two children who are 3 years and 1 year old.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn, chili and beans.  He has been working on his own crops for six years, having learned the business from his father who taught him the whole process.  He has a lot of experience.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy materials he needs for his crops: manure, herbicides, foliar fertilizers and corn seed.  This loan will allow him to have everything he needs to protect his crops from pests and strengthen his production.

Juan's aim is to work hard so that he can improve his crops and also his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, foliar fertilizers and corn seed

loans.name: Glenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Glenda, vive con su esposo y un hijo, la vivienda es familiar, ella administra una pupuseria, tiene dos años de estar en el negocio, lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para el negocio como aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, condimentos, entre otros  que son necesarios para mejorar las condiciones del negocio y aumentar la capacidad.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en el mercado, tener mayor estabilidad económica para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda lives with her husband and son in her family’s home. She has had a stand selling pupusas [traditional thick corn tortilla with fillings such as cheese, beans, and pork] for two years, which she started with the help of her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients she needs such as oil, cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, and condiments, which would help her improve her business and increase its capacity. Her goal is to grow in the market and have more financial security to support her family.

loans.use: purchase oil, cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio   tiene 41 años de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Joffre Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos orgánicos, químico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar buena semillas.

Las compras  y las ventas lo harán en Ventanas. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con los amigos.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio is 41 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

He is a member of the El Recreo community bank which is located in San Vicente Las Lomas, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in farming and livestock raising.

Joffre Antonio is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemical fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy good seeds.  He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Joffre Antonio's dream is to be able to provide his children with an education.  In his free time he enjoys spending time with his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es agricultor, albañil y tambien motorista, aprendió sus quehaceres por cuenta propia, tiene 5 años dedicándose a estas actividades de las que ha logrado tener los recursos para la familia.
El solicita un préstamo porque está iniciando la siembra de maíz, para ello debe aplicarle los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de alquiler del terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a tener los recursos económicos y poder invertir en lo mas necesario con el fin de tener una cosecha sana.
La aspiración de Daniel es mejorar su hogar, sus cultivos y poder agregar algo nuevo en sus tierras, para tener un nuevo cultivo.
texts.en:
Daniel lives with his wife and two kids. He is a farmer, bricklayer, and motorcycle driver. He learned these trades by himself and has worked in these fields for five years.  Through these trades, he has been able to earn an income for his family.

He is requesting a loan because he is starting to plant corn. He needs to pay rent on his fields and apply fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. The loan will give him the financial resources to invest in what he needs most to have a healthy crop. Daniel’s goals are to improve his home, his crop, and be able to add something new to his fields to have a new crop.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, and pay rent on his land.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 66 años tiene mucha alegría y ella nos comenta que tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20, vive en la lindísima ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad ubicada en la selva de nuestro país y la cual se caracteriza por tener una flora y fauna impresionante, se caracteriza además por sus platillos típicos, los cuales son muy deliciosos y sobre todo porque uno puede apreciar lo maravillosos de la naturaleza y puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad.  Norma es muy creativa y sobre todo tiene una muy buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de su ciudad por ello la comida que más le gusta es el riquísimo “Juane”, el cual contiene arroz, carne de gallina, huevo sancochado y aceituna, esta preparación está envuelta en hojas de plátano, es muy delicioso y agradable, así también en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su familia ya que está casada y junto a su esposo es madre de una  hija la cual es mayor de edad y quien la ayuda en su negocio. Norma solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación primaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Chef ya que le encanta cocinar.

Con mucho entusiasmo Norma trabaja en su negocio de venta de tamales en horas de la tarde y también tiene su negocio de alquiler de cuartos , Norma es muy trabajadora, se dedica a sus pequeños negocios alrededor de 9 horas al día, su hija la apoya con la venta de los tamales en su centro de trabajo y norma se encarga de la preparación y la atención a los clientes a quienes les alquila sus cuartos, ella cree que el va bien en sus negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo es respetuosa y tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de sus tamales.

Norma está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella para realizar mejoras en las habitaciones que alquila como pintado, compra de sabanas, mejoramiento de pisos , mejoramiento de puertas, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá ofrecer una mejora atención a  sus clientes los cuales en su mayoría son turistas y tendrán una mejor impresión de su ciudad, asimismo mejorara sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, para si poder seguir trabajando y luchar para ver hecho realidad sus más grande sueño: “ Apoyar a su hija para que  termine su carrera y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Norma is a very hard-working woman.  At 66 years of age, she is very cheerful and tells us that she has the spirit of a 20 year old.  She lives in the beautiful town of Pucallpa, a town which is located in the jungle and is noted for its impressive flora and fauna.  It is also known for its traditional dishes which are delicious.  Above all, it is well known because it is a place where it is possible to appreciate the marvels of nature and disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city.  

Norma is very creative and the traditional dishes from her town that she prepares taste really good.  Her favorite meal is 'Juanes' which is a dish that contains rice, chicken, hard-boiled egg and tuna.  This mixture is wrapped in banana leaves and it is delicious.  In her free time Norma really enjoys going for walks with her family.  Norma is married and has a grown-up daughter who helps her in her business.  Norma only studied up to the third year of her primary education but she would have liked to have gone on to study to become a chef because she loves cooking.

Norma works in her tamale business in the afternoon/evening with a lot of enthusiasm. She also has a business renting out rooms.  Norma is very hard working and works around 9 hours a day in her small businesses.  Her daughter supports her with her tamale sales in her workplace and Norma takes care of preparing the food and serving the customers who rent her rooms.  She believes that her businesses are doing well because she is kind to her customers and, above all, respectful.  Also, her tamales taste very good.

Norma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she is able to make some improvements to her rental rooms such as painting them, buying sheets, improving the flooring, improving the doors, etc.  This will enable her to offer her customers a better service.  Most of her customers are tourists and they will have a better impression of her town.  Norma will also be able to improve her income and, thereby, her quality of life.  She will be able to continue working hard in order to achieve her biggest dream: to support her daughter so that she can finish her degree and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to her rental rooms

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Akossiwa  est mère au foyer. Elle a 02 enfants dont 01 est scolarisé et son conjoint est transitaire. Margé l’âge avancé de madame Akossiwa, elle continue par vendre des habits (activité qu’elle a commencé en 1988) au marché. Elle sollicite un premier prêt de WAGES pour acheter des habits afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients en cette période de vacances. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant et créer d’autres points de vente. Son désir est de voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Akossiwa is a stay at home mother.  She has 2 children, one of whom attends school, and her husband is a transit agent.  In spite of her advanced age, Mrs. Akossiwa continues to sell clothing (a business she started in 1988) at the market.  She is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy clothing in order to better meet her customers' needs during this vacation season.  She wants to reinvest in her business and to create other points of sale.  Her desire is to see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and married with two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid for three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from a mobile grocery business.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college. This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, es agricultor y empleado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él aprendió la agricultura con su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, tiene 12 años de estar realizándolo para su familia, actualmente inicia su labor en la siembra de la milpa.
Él  está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los insumos agrícolas, que son necesarios para prevenir al cultivo de las plagas, como los herbicidas, abono, insecticidas, con todo esto estará preparado para iniciar su trabajo y para poder tener una mejor producción.
Su objetivo es mejorar su trabajo, siendo más productivas sus tierras,  además sembrar hortalizas para aumentar su trabajo y las posibilidades de mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Wilberto is a farmer and an employee. He lives with his wife and children.  

Wilberto learned how to farm from his father, who taught him the whole process.  He has been farming for his family for 12 years.  Wilberto is currently starting to sow his crops.  He is requesting a loan to buy the farm supplies he needs to protect his crops from pests.  He will buy herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides.
